intro: Hieracium hexameri, commonly known as the six-rayed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers, which are typically arranged in a single head with ray florets. It grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Hieracium hexameri is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
